Class AccountDatabase

java.lang.Object
util.List<Account>
banking.AccountDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Account>
public class AccountDatabase extends List<Account>
The AccountDatabase class holds the information regarding all the bank accounts. A new account is always added to the end of the array. An instance of this class is a growable list with an initial array capacity of 4, and it automatically increases the capacity by 4 whenever it is full. The list does not decrease in capacity.

  • Field Details

    • archive

      private final Archive archive
      Represents the archive of closed accounts within the AccountDatabase.

  • Constructor Details

    • AccountDatabase

      public AccountDatabase()
      Constructs an empty AccountDatabase object. Initializes a new Archive instance that will store accounts that have been closed.

  • Method Details

    • deposit

      public void deposit(AccountNumber number, double amount)
      Deposits money into an Account which will increase the Account's balance. Searches through the AccountDatabase for the Account before depositing the amount of money into that Account. Does nothing if Account is not found using the number.
      Parameters:
      number - AccountNumber that identifies the account
      amount - value of money that will be deposited

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(AccountNumber number, double amount)
      Checks if money can be withdrawn from an account. If the AccountType is Money Market and the balance falls below 2000, changes the AccountType to a savings account.
      Parameters:
      number - AccountNumber that identifies the Account
      amount - value of money that will be withdrawn
      Returns:
      true if the amount can be withdrawn false otherwise

    • closeAccount

      public void closeAccount(Account account, Date closeDate)
      Closes the specified account and removes it from the AccountDatabase.
      Parameters:
      account - the Account object to be closed
      closeDate - the Date on which the account is closed

    • find

      public int find(String firstName, String lastName, Date dateOfBirth)
      Finds the index of an account in the AccountDatabase based on the holder's first name, last name, and date of birth. The search is case-insensitive for the names.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the first name of the account holder to search for
      lastName - the last name of the account holder to search for
      dateOfBirth - the date of birth of the account holder to search for
      Returns:
      the index of the account if found in the AccountDatabase, -1 if the account is not found

    • find

      public int find(AccountNumber accountNumber)
      Checks if Account is contained in the AccountDatabase and returns index of location in database. Searches for an Account in the AccountDatabase using AccountNumber.
      Parameters:
      accountNumber - that is being searched for
      Returns:
      index of the Account in the AccountDatabase when found, -1 otherwise

    • contains

      public boolean contains(AccountNumber accountNumber)
      Checks if Account is contained in the AccountDatabase. Searches through the AccountDatabase for an Account using accountNumber.
      Parameters:
      accountNumber - that is being searched for
      Returns:
      true if Account is found in AccountDatabase false otherwise

    • contains

      public boolean contains(String firstName, String lastName, Date dateOfBirth, AccountType type)
      Checks if Account is contained in the AccountDatabase. Searches through the AccountDatabase for an Account based on first name, last name, dateOfBirth, and account type.
      Parameters:
      firstName - String that is being searched for, comparison is case-insensitive
      lastName - String that is being searched for, comparison is case-insensitive
      dateOfBirth - object that is being searched for
      type - AccountType object that is being searched for
      Returns:
      true if Account is found in AccountDatabase false otherwise

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Profile holder, AccountType type)
      Checks if an Account with the specified holder and account type exists in the AccountDatabase. Iterates through the list of accounts stored in the database.
      Parameters:
      holder - Profile object representing the account holder to search for
      type - AccountType object representing the type of account to search for
      Returns:
      true if an account with the specified holder and type is found in the database, false otherwise

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints all the Accounts in the AccountDatabase from the beginning of AccountDatabase to the end.

    • printByBranch

      public void printByBranch()
      Orders and prints AccountDatabase by the 2-digit String, Branch. Bubble Sort implementation is used to iterate through the array and swap adjacent elements if they are out of order. To print, iterate through AccountDatabase and print County followed by City.

    • printByHolder

      public void printByHolder()
      Orders and prints AccountDatabase by the name and date of birth of the account. Bubble Sort implementation is used to iterate through the array and swap adjacent elements if they are out of order. Calls the print() method.

    • printByType

      public void printByType()
      Orders and prints AccountDatabase by the AccountType. Bubble Sort implementation is used to iterate through the array and swap adjacent elements if they are out of order. The compareTo method referenced below compares by AccountNumber. Prints sorted by AccountType.

    • printArchive

      public void printArchive()
      Prints all the Accounts that have been closed and are in the Archive

    • printStatements

      public void printStatements()
      Prints the statements of all accounts in the AccountDatabase in a formatted manner. The method iterates through all accounts in the Account

    • loadAccounts

      public void loadAccounts(File file) throws IOException
      Loads account data from the provided file and adds the corresponding Account objects to the database. Each line in the file should represent an account in a comma-separated value format.
      Parameters:
      file - the File object containing account information to load
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file

    • processActivities

      public void processActivities(File file) throws IOException
      Processes activities from a file and applies them to accounts in the AccountDatabase. The method reads a file containing activity information in a comma-separated format and performs operations such as deposits or withdrawals on corresponding accounts.
      Parameters:
      file - the File object from which activity data is read
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
